discourse_list.title: [Request to Poll] MIP81 Arranger Approval & Amount to Allocate

content.content: MIP81 passed with overwhelming support and since then, the Core Unit teams and Arrangers have been working with the Coinbase team to complete the MIP requirements and assessments in advance of transferring the USDC to coinbase to earn the 2.37% institutional reward. CES has completed and posted the technical risk assessment of the smart contract implementation. The smart contract approach whilst not perfect, does provide some advantages with respect to on-chain transparency (all withdrawals and funding of the institutional rewards Safebox contract are completely transparent on chain) and potential future automation of the institutional rewards arrangement. However, this comes at the expense of the additional technical risks, engineering and audit costs that would be required to complete an implementation under this arrangement. To move MIP81 forward while the smart contract implementation is being finalized, the DAO can move forward with a MIP65-like implementation - traditional custodial arrangement with the trust/foundation responsible for managing the amounts custodied through resolutions approved by Maker Governance. Please note that under this arrangement, Coinbase will have full control of the funds rather than only a veto in the case of the smart contract implementation, but the trust/foundation would have well-known legal protections. Monetalis has stepped forward and offered to be the arranger for this MIP, as they have an existing functional relationship with Coinbase Prime via MIP65 - and the MIP21 implementation would generally mirror the existing MIP65 version. As a reminder, the arranger is responsible for setting up a safe structure that can be controlled by Maker governance and safely hold the RWA assets for Maker - and in this case comply with all necessary Coinbase Prime KYC/AML requirements. At least one community member, with legal credentials, must, through a public forum post, verify that the proposed entity is appropriate to onboard to Coinbase Prime. Should the James Asset PTC be the SPV holding vehicle (Trustee) - instructed by MakerDAO (and also used in MIP65)?  Yes No Abstain  MIP81 states that 33% or $1.6B USDC should be transferred to Coinbase upon deal execution. There is some ambiguity in the amount to be transferred that the DAO must ensure the envisioned amount is clarified and confirmed for the transfer. Today, 33% of the USDC PSM amounts to approximately $750M USDC. What should the maximum debt ceiling for MIP81 be?  $750M $1.6B No amount should be transferred (explain in comments)  Typically with RWA MIP implementations, the debt ceiling is raised gradually over time to the maximum approved debt ceiling. Given the community’s desire to move forward with the smart contract implementation, it may make sense to have the debt ceiling raise to the maximum be dependent upon the completion of the smart contract implementation. Should MakerDAO tie the debt ceiling and initial transfer of USDC to the implementation of the smart contract solution?  No, the maximum debt ceiling amount should be sent immediately Yes, transfer $250M until the smart contract is ready Yes, transfer $500M until the smart contract is ready
content.GPT-summary: The post explains the progress made on MIP81 and suggests a traditional custodial arrangement with the trust/foundation responsible for managing the amounts custodied through resolutions approved by Maker Governance. It also asks for feedback on the maximum debt ceiling for MIP81 and whether the debt ceiling and initial transfer of USDC should be tied to the implementation of the smart contract solution. The post also invites a community member with legal credentials to verify the proposed entity for onboarding to Coinbase Prime.
GPT-discussion-categories: Author of proposal is explaining proposal
3rd party or author wants to collaborate on proposal

content.content: Hey folks, wanted to post an update that GovAlpha are delaying the suggested MIP81 polls. With the Legal Assessment being posted yesterday, a lot of questions came up and it seems prudent to make sure we are following the assigned MIP process for Coinbase before we take a further vote. We’ll be chatting with CES-001 and SF-001 today to figure out the best path forward and will keep the community updated on the outcome. MIP81 details a signal take place for the onboarding of a legal entity, so at the very least that will need to take place rather than a facilitator directed poll. The other new information in the legal assessment will also be addressed, likely with a separate governance process. CC: @collateral-core-unit @strat-fin-core-unit @Recognized-Delegates
GPT-discussion-categories: 3rd party giving constructive criticism of proposal
None of the topics listed match

content.content: In addition to the legal risk assessment, is anyone performing a credit/market risk assessment? There are material sector headwinds that would be helpful to have reviewed and presented in light of a weakened overall picture and deteriorating environment for Coinbase, as reflected in public markets and by some TradFi analysts. Seems appropriate to have a bring down acknowledgement and reflection on the importance of these developments since MIP81 initially passed, and how the details as currently being proposed to the community respond. One such response could circle back to the legal discussion if there were embedded responsive risk terms or debt covenants, for example.    coindesk.com – 11 Jan 23    Coinbase Junk Bonds Further Downgraded by S&P on Weak Profitability,... The agency lowered Coinbase’s credit rating from BB to BB-, a further step away from investment grade.         CNBC – 11 Jan 23    Bank of America downgrades Coinbase, says consensus estimates may be 'way too... Wall Street is overestimating Coinbase's ability to weather a tough crypto environment, according to Bank of America.         CNBC – 10 Jan 23    Coinbase to slash 20% of workforce in second major round of job cuts CEO Brian Armstrong pointed to more pressure on the crypto sector thanks to "unscrupulous actors in the industry."
GPT-discussion-categories: 3rd party giving constructive criticism of proposal
None of the topics listed match

content.content: prose11:  it seems prudent to make sure we are following the assigned MIP process for Coinbase before we take a further vote   We want to echo this sentiment, especially with regards to any arrangement that is not authorized by MIP81. In particular, we want to draw attention to the following: “Maker Governance has complete ability to trigger a liquidation with a successful executive vote encoding an instruction to the authorized account users of the legal entity.” and “Maker Governance will be able to freely mint, burn, withdraw, and settle almost instantaneously in USDC (<6 mins), consistent with Coinbase Prime’s standard offering.” Note that this is inconsistent with a veto or other ability to block Maker governance from exercising full control over deposits and withdrawals. In our view, it would violate MIP81 as it is currently written, and no signals should be pursued for such an arrangement under MIP81.
GPT-discussion-categories: 3rd party giving constructive criticism of proposal
